Entries.default: "So you're the captain the whole port's been talking about? Aye, you do look like a fearsome sort." She slaps a hand onto the bartop with a hearty laugh. "Welcome to Dunnage."
"If it's a drink you're wanting, I got enough grog stocked to drown a shark. Food's another story." She doesn't look up from spit-shining the tankard in her hands.
"What you're having? I'll pour you a double."
"Ah. I guess the last concoction I made for him didn't do the trick, then? Poor bastard."
"There's one last tincture recipe I know that won't kill him. Probably. It's called Ondra's Bile, but I don't have all the ingredients in stock."
"You'll need a rotten hagfish, an unripened palm stone, and a vial of fire kelp extract. Have him mix it all with a half tankard of grog, and well... hope for the best."
"What do you know about the Floating Hangman?"

"Check the barrels around Lifter's Refuge for the rotten hagfish. You might be able to find unripened palm stone for sale somewhere in Radiant Court." She pours a drink but rather than passing it to a patron, she downs it herself.
Her eyes go wide, and she fumbles a bottle of spirits, spilling rum all over the counter.
"Why didn't you try Ondra's Bile earlier?"
"I did tell you the list of ingredients, aye? He'll have stuff dribbling out of both ends for a week, maybe two if he's really unlucky."
"Why do I need to get a rotten hagfish and not regular hagfish?"
"The goal is to make him vomit, remember? A rotting hagfish produces a special oil once it reaches a certain level of decay."
"Harker in the King's Coffin usually keeps some fire kelp extract on hand for... special purposes. Be careful when dealing with that one."

"No one survives the Floating Hangman. Or so they say. It's the ship of the dead.

"You spy it on the horizon, you flee as fast as you can."
